main event: A large orange light was observed at tree top level traveling rapidly to the east before suddenly disappearing near Milton-Freewater, Oregon.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 15 to 20 seconds., A member of the Milton-Freewater Sheriff's Office speculated it was a landing light from a crop duster., The object was described as bright and orange, roughly the size of 2/3 of the moon., The observer was awakened and saw the object traveling from west to east at about a 45-50 degree angle., The report was documented by the Aerial Phenomena Office at Project Blue Book.
witness description: Sheriff's Office members and police officers observed the light.
